name: Pengowl
description:
Brrrrrgh, it's cold! But that's not the case for an unlikely friendship between a penguin and an owl. Explore snowy environments and solve puzzles by using the unique movement provided by a flightless bird and its soaring counterpart!

This is a two-player split-screen experience! We recommend playing together, but online applications, like Parsec, will also work. Or go dual controllers! Two input devices are required, one for each player. This can be Keyboard & Mouse + a controller or two controllers.

--- Controls ---

Penguin

MoveWASD / Left Analog Stick
Jump (With Owl Perched)Space / Gamepad South
Slide/Dive (While Moving, Owl Not Perched)Shift / Gamepad East
Toggle BowE / Gamepad West
Charge BowLeft Click / Right Trigger
Fire Bow (After Charging Bow)Release Left Click / Right Trigger
Open DoorLeft Click / Right Trigger

Owl

FlyWASD / Left Analog Stick
Take Off (From Perch)Space / Gamepad South
Flutter (At Apex of Jump/After Penguin lets go of Jump)Shift / Gamepad East

--- Credits ---

Mike Farley3D Artist & AnimatorChad Van Patten3D Artist & Animator
Kend'or WilsonGame Design, Level Design, & Sounds
Charles ReverandProgramming, UI, & Environment

Created in one month! This is the 6th project for GSAS-4510 | Experimental Game Design.
